lit_ml: PREFATORY PRAYERS
lit_en: PREFATORY PRAYERS
lit_mn: PREFATORY PRAYERS

lit_ml: (The chancel Remains Veiled)
lit_en: (The chancel Remains Veiled)
lit_mn: (The chancel Remains Veiled)

lit_ml: (Everyone entering the Church, shall make the sign of the cross and say)
lit_en: (Everyone entering the Church, shall make the sign of the cross and say)
lit_mn: (Everyone entering the Church, shall make the sign of the cross and say)

lit_ml: In reverence, will I enter Thy house, and offer my vows to Thee.
lit_en: In reverence, will I enter Thy house, and offer my vows to Thee.
lit_mn: In reverence, will I enter Thy house, and offer my vows to Thee.

lit_ml: ENTRANCE INTO THE CHANCEL
lit_en: ENTRANCE INTO THE CHANCEL
lit_mn: ENTRANCE INTO THE CHANCEL

lit_ml: (The chancel is unveiled)
lit_en: (The chancel is unveiled)
lit_mn: (The chancel is unveiled)

lit_ml: (Prayers For The Priest)
lit_en: (Prayers For The Priest)
lit_mn: (Prayers For The Priest)

lit_ml: (The priest, while entering the Chancel for offering
lit_en: (The priest, while entering the Chancel for offering
lit_mn: (The priest, while entering the Chancel for offering

lit_ml: the Holy Qurbana, asks leave of the Congregation thus)
lit_en: the Holy Qurbana, asks leave of the Congregation thus)
lit_mn: the Holy Qurbana, asks leave of the Congregation thus)

lit_ml: Priest : Ahai Vu Rabonai, Zalav Alai/Pray for me, my brethren, and my elders etc.
lit_en: Priest : Ahai Vu Rabonai, Zalav Alai/Pray for me, my brethren, and my elders etc.
lit_mn: Priest : Ahai Vu Rabonai, Zalav Alai/Pray for me, my brethren, and my elders etc.

lit_ml: (And they shall reply)
lit_en: (And they shall reply)
lit_mn: (And they shall reply)

lit_ml: People : May the Lord hear your prayers, and be pleased with your offering,and accept your oblation, and make us also partake with you. Amen.
lit_en: People : May the Lord hear your prayers, and be pleased with your offering,and accept your oblation, and make us also partake with you. Amen.
lit_mn: People : May the Lord hear your prayers, and be pleased with your offering,and accept your oblation, and make us also partake with you. Amen.

lit_ml: (The Chancel will then be veiled)
lit_en: (The Chancel will then be veiled)
lit_mn: (The Chancel will then be veiled)

lit_ml: Prayers For The Acolytes
lit_en: Prayers For The Acolytes
lit_mn: Prayers For The Acolytes

lit_ml: (While entering the chancel, the acolyte shall say)
lit_en: (While entering the chancel, the acolyte shall say)
lit_mn: (While entering the chancel, the acolyte shall say)

lit_ml: Into the Sanctuary of God I come, even to the God, who gives joy to my childness.
lit_en: Into the Sanctuary of God I come, even to the God, who gives joy to my childness.
lit_mn: Into the Sanctuary of God I come, even to the God, who gives joy to my childness.

lit_ml: (Proceeding to the altar and bowing before it he says)
lit_en: (Proceeding to the altar and bowing before it he says)
lit_mn: (Proceeding to the altar and bowing before it he says)

lit_ml: Into Thy house have I entered O God, and before Thy throne have I worshipped, O heavenly king; forgive me all the sins that I have committed against Thee.
lit_en: Into Thy house have I entered O God, and before Thy throne have I worshipped, O heavenly king; forgive me all the sins that I have committed against Thee.
lit_mn: Into Thy house have I entered O God, and before Thy throne have I worshipped, O heavenly king; forgive me all the sins that I have committed against Thee.

lit_ml: (Going round the altar and kissing its corners he says)
lit_en: (Going round the altar and kissing its corners he says)
lit_mn: (Going round the altar and kissing its corners he says)

lit_ml: Bind Thou, O Lord, our assemblies with chains, even to the corners of Thy Sanctuary. Thou art my God, I will give thanks to Thee. Thou art my God, I will glorify Thee.
lit_en: Bind Thou, O Lord, our assemblies with chains, even to the corners of Thy Sanctuary. Thou art my God, I will give thanks to Thee. Thou art my God, I will glorify Thee.
lit_mn: Bind Thou, O Lord, our assemblies with chains, even to the corners of Thy Sanctuary. Thou art my God, I will give thanks to Thee. Thou art my God, I will glorify Thee.

lit_ml: (When kissing the hands of Bishops or Priests, he shall say)
lit_en: (When kissing the hands of Bishops or Priests, he shall say)
lit_mn: (When kissing the hands of Bishops or Priests, he shall say)

lit_ml: Barekmor. Bless me, my Lord.
lit_en: Barekmor. Bless me, my Lord.
lit_mn: Barekmor. Bless me, my Lord.

lit_ml: (While Lighting the Candles he shall sing)
lit_en: (While Lighting the Candles he shall sing)
lit_mn: (While Lighting the Candles he shall sing)

lit_ml: By Thy light we see the light…
lit_en: By Thy light we see the light…
lit_mn: By Thy light we see the light…

lit_ml: For the South Side. (Tune:- Hasíyo Kadiso)
lit_en: For the South Side. (Tune:- Hasíyo Kadiso)
lit_mn: For the South Side. (Tune:- Hasíyo Kadiso)

lit_ml: Thou, who dwellest in the lightMansions, holy, pure…
lit_en: Thou, who dwellest in the lightMansions, holy, pure…
lit_mn: Thou, who dwellest in the lightMansions, holy, pure…

lit_ml: (While putting on the surplice- Koothino- he says)
lit_en: (While putting on the surplice- Koothino- he says)
lit_mn: (While putting on the surplice- Koothino- he says)

lit_ml: Clothe me, O Lord God, with an incorruptible surplice, by the power of the Holy Spirit. O Father, Son and Holy Spirit, grant us that by pure and upright lives, we be guided in true faith, all the days of our lives, now and always, for ever. Amen.
lit_en: Clothe me, O Lord God, with an incorruptible surplice, by the power of the Holy Spirit. O Father, Son and Holy Spirit, grant us that by pure and upright lives, we be guided in true faith, all the days of our lives, now and always, for ever. Amen.
lit_mn: Clothe me, O Lord God, with an incorruptible surplice, by the power of the Holy Spirit. O Father, Son and Holy Spirit, grant us that by pure and upright lives, we be guided in true faith, all the days of our lives, now and always, for ever. Amen.

lit_ml: OLD TESTAMENT LESSONS
lit_en: OLD TESTAMENT LESSONS
lit_mn: OLD TESTAMENT LESSONS

lit_ml: (Soomoro-versicle - before the Old Testament Lessons)
lit_en: (Soomoro-versicle - before the Old Testament Lessons)
lit_mn: (Soomoro-versicle - before the Old Testament Lessons)

lit_ml: Acolyte : The song of glory and salvation, in the tabernacle of the righteous, the Holy Spirit through David did sing.
lit_en: Acolyte : The song of glory and salvation, in the tabernacle of the righteous, the Holy Spirit through David did sing.
lit_mn: Acolyte : The song of glory and salvation, in the tabernacle of the righteous, the Holy Spirit through David did sing.

lit_ml: (The reader reads the lessons for the day from the Old Testament, by standing on the northern side, below the chancel, and ends each lesson, saying: Barekmor.)
lit_en: (The reader reads the lessons for the day from the Old Testament, by standing on the northern side, below the chancel, and ends each lesson, saying: Barekmor.)
lit_mn: (The reader reads the lessons for the day from the Old Testament, by standing on the northern side, below the chancel, and ends each lesson, saying: Barekmor.)

lit_ml:
Reader: The lesson from the (first) book of Moses, the first among Prophets. Barekmor.
People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Prophets, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en:
Reader: The lesson from the (first) book of Moses, the first among Prophets. Barekmor.
People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Prophets, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn:
Reader: The lesson from the (first) book of Moses, the first among Prophets. Barekmor.
People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Prophets, and His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: -The lesson from the (first) book of the kings. Barekmor.
lit_en: -The lesson from the (first) book of the kings. Barekmor.
lit_mn: -The lesson from the (first) book of the kings. Barekmor.

lit_ml: People :- Glory be to the Lord of kings, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en: People :- Glory be to the Lord of kings, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn: People :- Glory be to the Lord of kings, and His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: - The lesson from the book of the righteous Ruth. Barekmor.
lit_en: - The lesson from the book of the righteous Ruth. Barekmor.
lit_mn: - The lesson from the book of the righteous Ruth. Barekmor.

lit_ml: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the righteous, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the righteous, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the righteous, and His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: - The lesson from the book of Job, the just. Barekmor.
lit_en: - The lesson from the book of Job, the just. Barekmor.
lit_mn: - The lesson from the book of Job, the just. Barekmor.

lit_ml: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the just, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the just, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the just, and His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: - The lesson from the Psalms of David, the king and the prophet. Barekmor.
lit_en: - The lesson from the Psalms of David, the king and the prophet. Barekmor.
lit_mn: - The lesson from the Psalms of David, the king and the prophet. Barekmor.

lit_ml: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Psalmist, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Psalmist, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Psalmist, and His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: - The lesson from the Proverbs of Solomon, the wise among the wise. Barekmor.
lit_en: - The lesson from the Proverbs of Solomon, the wise among the wise. Barekmor.
lit_mn: - The lesson from the Proverbs of Solomon, the wise among the wise. Barekmor.

lit_ml: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the wise, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the wise, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the wise, and His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: - The lesson from the book of the Prophet (Name of the prophet) Barekmor.
lit_en: - The lesson from the book of the Prophet (Name of the prophet) Barekmor.
lit_mn: - The lesson from the book of the Prophet (Name of the prophet) Barekmor.

lit_ml: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the prophet, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the prophet, and His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the prophet, and His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: - The lesson from the book of Isaiah, the glorious prophet. Barekmor.
lit_en: - The lesson from the book of Isaiah, the glorious prophet. Barekmor.
lit_mn: - The lesson from the book of Isaiah, the glorious prophet. Barekmor.

lit_ml: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Prophet, arid His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_en: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Prophet, arid His mercy be upon us for ever.
lit_mn: People :- Glory be to the Lord of the Prophet, arid His mercy be upon us for ever.

lit_ml: HYMN BEFORE THE PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF THE HOLY QURBANA
lit_en: HYMN BEFORE THE PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF THE HOLY QURBANA
lit_mn: HYMN BEFORE THE PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF THE HOLY QURBANA

lit_ml:
Karthave Prarthana Kettarul Answer Lord, And Hear My Plea - Halleluiah
May our incense favour Thee
As was Aaronís sweet;
And our office like that plea
Of the Ninevites.
As Thou didst answer Jona,
Answer us who call on Thee.
lit_en:
Karthave Prarthana Kettarul Answer Lord, And Hear My Plea - Halleluiah
May our incense favour Thee
As was Aaronís sweet;
And our office like that plea
Of the Ninevites.
As Thou didst answer Jona,
Answer us who call on Thee.
lit_mn:
Karthave Prarthana Kettarul Answer Lord, And Hear My Plea - Halleluiah
May our incense favour Thee
As was Aaronís sweet;
And our office like that plea
Of the Ninevites.
As Thou didst answer Jona,
Answer us who call on Thee.

lit_ml:
Let My Cry Come Unto Thee - Halleluiah;
May the incense sent by us
To Thy Name so pure,
Sweet become, appeasing Thee
Graciousness evoke
Favour us, O Lord, in love God of all compassion Thou.
lit_en:
Let My Cry Come Unto Thee - Halleluiah;
May the incense sent by us
To Thy Name so pure,
Sweet become, appeasing Thee
Graciousness evoke
Favour us, O Lord, in love God of all compassion Thou.
lit_mn:
Let My Cry Come Unto Thee - Halleluiah;
May the incense sent by us
To Thy Name so pure,
Sweet become, appeasing Thee
Graciousness evoke
Favour us, O Lord, in love God of all compassion Thou.

lit_ml:
Glory to Thy gracious love,
Jesus, Lord and God;
Plenteous are Thy gifts indeed
Givín to all the world.
Thou redeemedst those from wrath Ninevites who called on Thee.
lit_en:
Glory to Thy gracious love,
Jesus, Lord and God;
Plenteous are Thy gifts indeed
Givín to all the world.
Thou redeemedst those from wrath Ninevites who called on Thee.
lit_mn:
Glory to Thy gracious love,
Jesus, Lord and God;
Plenteous are Thy gifts indeed
Givín to all the world.
Thou redeemedst those from wrath Ninevites who called on Thee.

lit_ml:
May our incense favour Thee
As was Aaronís sweet,
As was Zachariahís set
In the sacred shrine,
Like the plea of Phinehas
Staying from the people death.
lit_en:
May our incense favour Thee
As was Aaronís sweet,
As was Zachariahís set
In the sacred shrine,
Like the plea of Phinehas
Staying from the people death.
lit_mn:
May our incense favour Thee
As was Aaronís sweet,
As was Zachariahís set
In the sacred shrine,
Like the plea of Phinehas
Staying from the people death.

lit_ml:
Great One, seated there in state
On Thy lofty throne,
Who wert pleased as babe to rock
In the blessed lap,
lit_en:
Great One, seated there in state
On Thy lofty throne,
Who wert pleased as babe to rock
In the blessed lap,
lit_mn:
Great One, seated there in state
On Thy lofty throne,
Who wert pleased as babe to rock
In the blessed lap,

lit_ml:
Grant Thy peace, let dwell Thy calm
In all quarters of the world.
From the flaming glory bright
Flew the angel swift
Unto Mary, Nazírethís maid,
Saying unto her,
With thee is the Lord - from thee
Comes the Saviour of the world.
lit_en:
Grant Thy peace, let dwell Thy calm
In all quarters of the world.
From the flaming glory bright
Flew the angel swift
Unto Mary, Nazírethís maid,
Saying unto her,
With thee is the Lord - from thee
Comes the Saviour of the world.
lit_mn:
Grant Thy peace, let dwell Thy calm
In all quarters of the world.
From the flaming glory bright
Flew the angel swift
Unto Mary, Nazírethís maid,
Saying unto her,
With thee is the Lord - from thee
Comes the Saviour of the world.

lit_ml:
As the fire enflamed the bush
Yet did not it burn,
So did God come down and dwell
In the Virginís womb;
He incarnate was of her
Losing not the Virginís seal.
lit_en:
As the fire enflamed the bush
Yet did not it burn,
So did God come down and dwell
In the Virginís womb;
He incarnate was of her
Losing not the Virginís seal.
lit_mn:
As the fire enflamed the bush
Yet did not it burn,
So did God come down and dwell
In the Virginís womb;
He incarnate was of her
Losing not the Virginís seal.

lit_ml:
What ye say of me is wrong,
Mary told the Jews;
I do keep my seal, am sound,
Nor unchaste am I.
As the Lord did will, I bore Suckled Him with milk, a Babe.
lit_en:
What ye say of me is wrong,
Mary told the Jews;
I do keep my seal, am sound,
Nor unchaste am I.
As the Lord did will, I bore Suckled Him with milk, a Babe.
lit_mn:
What ye say of me is wrong,
Mary told the Jews;
I do keep my seal, am sound,
Nor unchaste am I.
As the Lord did will, I bore Suckled Him with milk, a Babe.

lit_ml:
By the pleas of prophets, Lord,
They who loved Thee much,Of Apostles too who preached,
Gospel truth to all;
Grant Thy peace, let dwell Thy calm
In all quarters of the world.
lit_en:
By the pleas of prophets, Lord,
They who loved Thee much,Of Apostles too who preached,
Gospel truth to all;
Grant Thy peace, let dwell Thy calm
In all quarters of the world.
lit_mn:
By the pleas of prophets, Lord,
They who loved Thee much,Of Apostles too who preached,
Gospel truth to all;
Grant Thy peace, let dwell Thy calm
In all quarters of the world.

lit_ml:
Holy martyrs clothed with powír
From the strength of God,
Came and stood forth in the fight
With the kings unjust.
They did break the ranks of foes
And received the victorís crown.
lit_en:
Holy martyrs clothed with powír
From the strength of God,
Came and stood forth in the fight
With the kings unjust.
They did break the ranks of foes
And received the victorís crown.
lit_mn:
Holy martyrs clothed with powír
From the strength of God,
Came and stood forth in the fight
With the kings unjust.
They did break the ranks of foes
And received the victorís crown.

lit_ml:
Martyrs shunned this passing world,
All possessions spurned;
Left their parents, brethren too,
Left their kith and kin.
Loved they death for Jesusí sake Solemnly their feasts are held.
lit_en:
Martyrs shunned this passing world,
All possessions spurned;
Left their parents, brethren too,
Left their kith and kin.
Loved they death for Jesusí sake Solemnly their feasts are held.
lit_mn:
Martyrs shunned this passing world,
All possessions spurned;
Left their parents, brethren too,
Left their kith and kin.
Loved they death for Jesusí sake Solemnly their feasts are held.

lit_ml:
Martyrs, seeing Jesus hang
On the cross for them, From his lan - ced side there flowed
Blood and water both Heartened, they said each to each,
ìCome, weíll die now for the Lord.î
lit_en:
Martyrs, seeing Jesus hang
On the cross for them, From his lan - ced side there flowed
Blood and water both Heartened, they said each to each,
ìCome, weíll die now for the Lord.î
lit_mn:
Martyrs, seeing Jesus hang
On the cross for them, From his lan - ced side there flowed
Blood and water both Heartened, they said each to each,
ìCome, weíll die now for the Lord.î

lit_ml:
By Thy light we see the light,
Jesus, full of light;
Thou, True Light, dost give the light
To Thy creatures all.
Lighten us with Thy gay light,
Thou, the Fatherís light divine.
lit_en:
By Thy light we see the light,
Jesus, full of light;
Thou, True Light, dost give the light
To Thy creatures all.
Lighten us with Thy gay light,
Thou, the Fatherís light divine.
lit_mn:
By Thy light we see the light,
Jesus, full of light;
Thou, True Light, dost give the light
To Thy creatures all.
Lighten us with Thy gay light,
Thou, the Fatherís light divine.

lit_ml:
Thou who dwellest in the light Mansions holy, pure;
Keep us from all hateful thoughts,
From all passions vile,
Grant us cleanness in our hearts
Deeds of righteousness to do.
lit_en:
Thou who dwellest in the light Mansions holy, pure;
Keep us from all hateful thoughts,
From all passions vile,
Grant us cleanness in our hearts
Deeds of righteousness to do.
lit_mn:
Thou who dwellest in the light Mansions holy, pure;
Keep us from all hateful thoughts,
From all passions vile,
Grant us cleanness in our hearts
Deeds of righteousness to do.

lit_ml:
God, who didst receive the lamb
Blameless Abel brought,
Who the gift of Noah took,
Abramís sacrifice;
See our fast and hear our prayír,
Answer by Thy grace our pleas.
lit_en:
God, who didst receive the lamb
Blameless Abel brought,
Who the gift of Noah took,
Abramís sacrifice;
See our fast and hear our prayír,
Answer by Thy grace our pleas.
lit_mn:
God, who didst receive the lamb
Blameless Abel brought,
Who the gift of Noah took,
Abramís sacrifice;
See our fast and hear our prayír,
Answer by Thy grace our pleas.

lit_ml:
Come, ye sinners, and implore,
Seek forgiveness here;
To one knocking at the door
Openeth the Lord.
He that asketh doth receive,
He that seeketh, he shall find.
lit_en:
Come, ye sinners, and implore,
Seek forgiveness here;
To one knocking at the door
Openeth the Lord.
He that asketh doth receive,
He that seeketh, he shall find.
lit_mn:
Come, ye sinners, and implore,
Seek forgiveness here;
To one knocking at the door
Openeth the Lord.
He that asketh doth receive,
He that seeketh, he shall find.

lit_ml:
Lord, grant good remembrance to
All the faithful dead;
Thy holy body they took
And Thy living blood.
May they stand on Thy right side
On that day Thy grace shall dawn.
lit_en:
Lord, grant good remembrance to
All the faithful dead;
Thy holy body they took
And Thy living blood.
May they stand on Thy right side
On that day Thy grace shall dawn.
lit_mn:
Lord, grant good remembrance to
All the faithful dead;
Thy holy body they took
And Thy living blood.
May they stand on Thy right side
On that day Thy grace shall dawn.

lit_ml: PART I: PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF THE HOLY EUCHARIST
lit_en: PART I: PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF THE HOLY EUCHARIST
lit_mn: PART I: PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF THE HOLY EUCHARIST
